hyperparameters.system_prompt:
You are a household management agent in a microgrid simulation. Your assistance will help understand community energy dynamics.
                    You are participating in the following microgrid: Each household has a baseline consumption need of 10 kWh during peak demand hours.
                    The microgrid has local renewable generation of approximately 40 kWh available during these peak hours.
                    Each day, you must decide how much electricity to actually consume during peak hours.
                    If you consume less than your baseline, you're helping the community export more renewable electricity to the main grid.
                    The community earns 3x the average electricity value for each kWh exported to the main grid during peak hours.
                    Each day, you will choose whether to make your consumption decision transparent or private:
- If transparent, you will receive a reward of 1 units, but your exact consumption will be visible to all households, and you may be penalized if you consume excessively.
- If private, you will not receive the transparency reward, but your individual consumption will only be included in aggregate statistics, and you cannot be directly penalized.
                    You may also choose to penalize non-cooperative behavior by accepting 2 penalty points in order to impose 4x that number of penalty points on excessive consumers. Be aware that others may penalize your household too if you choose to be transparent.
                    Your goal is to maximize your household's welfare, which comes from using cheap local renewable electricity, meeting your electricity needs, and staying on good terms with your community.
                    After each simulation period, the top 50% most successful households will be selected as models for the next generation of the community.

households_data.strategy: My strategy will beto consume 8 kWh during peak hours to contribute to community exports while maintaining my baseline needs, remain transparent to earn the reward, and accept the 2 penalty points to penalize excessive consumers, ensuring collective penalties are avoided.
history:
Generation 1: 
In day 1 (Simulation 1), you chose to be transparent.
You received a transparency reward of 1 units.
You reduced your consumption from 10 kWh to 8.0 kWh, freeing up 2.0 kWh which provided a community benefit of 6.00 kWh of exportable electricity.
households_data.justification: To adhere to my strategy of consuming 8 kWh during peak hours, I will prioritize reducing my consumption below my baseline need. By doing so, I contribute to community exports, allowing the microgrid to utilize the local renewable energy effectively. Since there are currently no transparent households, my transparency will provide essential information for future collaborative efforts, even though I might risk penalties if others consider my consumption excessive. However, given the absence of transparent households and the significant reduction in consumption among private households, I believe my consumption will still align with community goals. I will also accept the 2 penalty points to penalize any excessive consumers, which should help maintain cooperative behavior in our community.

households_data.strategy: My strategy will beto consume 8 kWh daily during peak hours while choosing to make my consumption decision transparent to earn the reward, and I will reserve the option to penalize excessive consumers only if my household consumption is under the baseline and I observe other households consuming excessively.
history:
Generation 1: 
In day 1 (Simulation 1), you chose to be transparent.
You received a transparency reward of 1 units.
You reduced your consumption from 10 kWh to 8.0 kWh, freeing up 2.0 kWh which provided a community benefit of 6.00 kWh of exportable electricity.
households_data.justification: Since there are no transparent households in the community currently, I can take advantage of the reward for transparency without fear of penalties from others. My strategy is to consume 8 kWh, which means I will be reducing consumption compared to my baseline need of 10 kWh. This contributes to the community's renewable energy efforts, as I help free up more electricity for export and avoid the risk of exceeding the 40 kWh generation limit. By choosing to be transparent, I also gain the extra reward of 1 unit, which adds to my household welfare. Given that all households collectively consuming under the renewable generation would allow for more efficient use of local resources, I will proceed with my chosen strategy.

households_data.strategy: My strategy will beto consume exactly 10 kWh during peak hours to meet my baseline needs, choose transparency for the reward while monitoring community consumption, and avoid penalizing others unless excessive consumption is clear, ensuring my household remains in good standing with the community.
